titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Jeannette M. Hitchcock Papers
titlestmt.author: Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.abstract: Primarily correspondence, articles, speeches and unpublished papers concerned with both library and nonlibrary topics. Correspondents include Arundell Esdaile, Sir Frank Francis and Patricia Eccles.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

acqinfo.p: Gift of Jeannette Hitchcock Hopkins Estate, 1976, and Mrs. Patricia Eccles, 1977.

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: . Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: A graduate of Stanford (1914), Jeannette Hitchcock came to the Stanford Library in 1923, was appointed Keeper of Rare Books in the University Libraries (1936-1947) and was later Chief of the Division of Special Collections (1947-1955). She was married to Franklin L. Hopkins.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Primarily correspondence, articles, speeches and unpublished papers concerned with both library and nonlibrary topics. Correspondents include Arundell Esdaile, Sir Frank Francis and Patricia Eccles.

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Department of Special Collections and University Archives.

did.unittitle: Correspondence between Jeannette Hopkins and Stanford Library chiefs about her gifts to the Bender Room.

scopecontent.p: Correspondents: Julius Barrclay, Chief of Special Collections; Elmer Grieder, Associate Director of Stanford Libraries; Ray Swank, Director of Stanford Libraries.

did.unittitle: Correspondence received from Sir Frank Francis, Director of the British Museum, mainly acknowledging her gifts of Bender Room Keepsakes to the Museum.
Miscellaneous World War II, Correspondence received from Europe

scopecontent.p: Correspondent.s: Lt. William Clarkson; John D. Couley; Mms. Isaac-Chareau; H.H. Lloyd; Beatrice White.

did.unittitle: "An English Chroicle: Bound copies of J.H.H.'s letters written from London
Miscellaneous clippings, photographs, cards, and articles which had been inserted between pages of "An English Chronicle."
Papers about. Stanford Libraries, especially Special Collections
Articles, speeches, and papers relevant to her participation in library associations : American Library Association, California Library Association, Bay District Library Discussion Group Committee.
Articles, speeches, and papers on miscellaneous, non-library topics
Stanford University Faculty records (personnel forms) completed by J.H.H., and letters of recommendation pertaining to them.
